intro: Didactyle quadricolor, commonly known as the four-colored didactyle, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, multicolored bracts that resemble petals. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are opposite in arrangement. Its flowers are small and clustered in whorls, often surrounded by vibrant, colorful foliage that makes it a popular ornamental plant. Due to its unique appearance, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant in warmer climates.
